question: What are the geopolitical implications of semiconductor supply chain concentration?

expert_sources.title: Chip War: The Fight for the World's Most Critical Technology
Taiwan's Role in the Global Semiconductor Supply Chain
China's Semiconductor Ambitions
expert_sources.venue: Center for Strategic and International Studies

key_findings.finding: TSMC in Taiwan produces ~90% of advanced (<7nm) chips, creating critical chokepoint
Chips are essential for military systems, AI, and economic competitiveness
US CHIPS Act allocates $52B to rebuild domestic semiconductor manufacturing
US export controls aim to prevent China from developing advanced AI/military chips
Building a leading-edge fab takes 3-5 years and $20B+, limiting rapid reshoring
Equipment for chip manufacturing is also concentrated (ASML for EUV lithography)

known_counterarguments.argument: Market forces will naturally diversify supply chains
known_counterarguments.validity: Partially valid, but economics favor concentration
Debatable, but risk is non-zero and consequences severe

known_counterarguments.argument: Export controls may accelerate Chinese self-sufficiency
known_counterarguments.validity: Possible long-term, but near-term delays are significant

areas_of_uncertainty: China's ability to catch up technologically

must_include: US CHIPS Act or similar policy response
